name: Docker
title: This is a quick reference cheat sheet for [Docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-started/). And you can find the most common Docker commands here.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This is a quick reference cheat sheet for [Docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-started/). And you can find the most common Docker commands here.

cards.title: Getting started
cards.body: Create and run a container in background

```shell script
$ docker run -d -p 80:80 docker/getting-started

cards.code:
---

- `-d` - Run the container in detached mode
- `-p 80:80` - Map port 80 to port 80 in the container
- `docker/getting-started` - The image to use

{.marker-none}

Create and run a container in foreground

```shell script
$ docker run -it -p 8001:8080 --name my-nginx nginx

cards.body:
• `-it` - Interactive bash mode
• `-p 8001:8080` - Map port 8001 to port 8080 in the container
• `--name my-nginx` - Specify a name
• `nginx` - The image to use

cards.title: General commands
cards.body:
| Example | Description | | ----------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | | `docker ps` | List running containers | | `docker ps -a` | List all containers | | `docker ps -s` | List running containers
_(with CPU / memory)_ | | `docker images` | List all images | | `docker exec -it bash` | Connecting to container | | `docker logs ` | Shows container's console log | | `docker stop ` | Stop a container | | `docker restart ` | Restart a container | | `docker rm ` | Remove a container | | `docker port ` | Shows container's port mapping | | `docker top ` | List processes | | `docker kill ` | Kill a container |
Parameter `<container>` can be container id or name

cards.title: Creating
cards.code:
docker create [options] IMAGE
  -a, --attach               # attach stdout/err
  -i, --interactive          # attach stdin (interactive)
  -t, --tty                  # pseudo-tty
      --name NAME            # name your image
  -p, --publish 5000:5000    # port map (host:container)
      --expose 5432          # expose a port to containers
  -P, --publish-all          # publish all ports
      --link container:alias # linking
  -v, --volume `pwd`:/app    # mount (absolute paths needed)
  -e, --env NAME=hello       # env vars

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
$ docker create --name my_redis --expose 6379 redis:3.0.2

### Manipulating

Renaming a Container

```shell script

cards.body: Removing a Container

```shell script

cards.code:
Updating a Container

```shell script
docker update --cpu-shares 512 -m 300M my-nginx

cards.title: Manipulating
cards.body:
| `Example`                          | Description                     |
| ---------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| `docker images`                    | Listing images                  |
| `docker rmi nginx`                 | Removing an image               |
| `docker load < ubuntu.tar.gz`      | Loading a tarred repository     |
| `docker load --input ubuntu.tar`   | Loading a tarred repository     |
| `docker save busybox > ubuntu.tar` | Save an image to a tar archive  |
| `docker history`                   | Showing the history of an image |

cards.title: Building Images
cards.body:
```shell script
$ docker build .
$ docker build github.com/creack/docker-firefox
$ docker build - < Dockerfile
$ docker build - < context.tar.gz
$ docker build -t eon/my-nginx .
$ docker build -f myOtherDockerfile .
$ curl example.com/remote/Dockerfile | docker build -f - .

cards.code:
## Docker Networking {.cols-2}

### Manipulating

Removing a network

```shell script
docker network rm MyOverlayNetwork

cards.body: Listing networks

```shell script
docker network ls

cards.code:
Getting information about a network

```shell script
docker network inspect MyOverlayNetwork

cards.body: Connecting a running container to a network

```shell script
docker network connect MyOverlayNetwork nginx

cards.code:
Connecting a container to a network when it starts

```shell script
docker run -it -d --network=MyOverlayNetwork nginx

cards.body: Disconnecting a container from a network

```shell script
docker network disconnect MyOverlayNetwork nginx

cards.code:
### Batch clean

| Example                             | Description             |
| ----------------------------------- | ----------------------- |
| `docker stop -f $(docker ps -a -q)` | Stopping all containers |
| `docker rm -f $(docker ps -a -q)`   | Removing all containers |
| `docker rmi -f $(docker images -q)` | Removing all images     |
